alert.note: Alert for Humboldt (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 06 at 12:35AM PDT until August 06 at 1:30AM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM PDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR NORTHEASTERN HUMBOLDT COUNTY... At 1235 AM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated that heavy rain was falling in Martin Creek near Paradise Valley. Between 0.6 and 1.2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.1 to 0.3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. In addition the flood gauge at Martin Creek has shown a rapid response and now reads 4.54 feet. Action stage is 5.0 feet. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Paradise Valley, McDermitt, Chimney Dam Reservoir and Twin Creeks Mine. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
